direction.raw_text: hope the children are home." "We have to dodge bullets tonight." "Vorster must hang for this."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hope the world hears about this."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. GORDON'S HOUSE - EVENING Silence. A small three-room Soweto brick house -- The living room is modestly furnished. EMILY, Gordon's 40-year-old wife, is sitting on a narrow iron bedstead against the wall, clutching her youngest 2-year-old son -- Her mind is preoccupied. Sitting next to her is a ten-year-old daughter. Gordon is sitting on a chair at the table with his second eldest son, Robert -- aged 14 years -- standing by the side of the table -- sitting on an old easy chair is a Soweto resident with his 15-year-old DAUGHTER standing beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to girl) Are you sure it was Jonathan they took away? The girl glances at her father.    He coaxes her to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, baba, with Wellington. INT. SOWETO POLICE STATION - DAY Black parents, waiting. At the counter with Gordon, a large black man, STANLEY, a friend -- his big easy smile is working hard on a white policeman, the station SERGEANT VAN ZYL, about to run out of patience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, I understand, Baas, but is that all the names? There's no other list somewhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you. He's not in custody. Have you tried the hospital? Have you tried the mortuary? Gordon sucks in his breath audibly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only suggesting the possibilities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, what about John Voster Square? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I've tried to help you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Stanley walks up to a WOMAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here too, sis Paulina, who are you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They picked up my girl -- 13-year- old girl!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are all searching. The policeman calls her -- she hurries to the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The crowd parts to let them through.    Other women reach out to touch her. Gordon looks into the last drawer, Jonathan is not there. They make their way out past the other parents and a group of mourning women sitting. EXT. MORTUARY - DAY Gordon, Emily and their friends cross to Stanley's great white elderly Dodge, this "etembalami" with the big butter- fly. For, amongst other things, he is the owner and driver of a pirate taxi. They get in. Stanley pauses -- looks across at a small red VW Beetle parked nearby, waiting. He shakes his head -- the VW flashes its lights and drives off. INT. STANLEY'S TAXI - DAY Inside they sit in silence... recovering from the ordeal. Only Emily silently whispers "Thank God, thank God." After a while...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is our son... we must find him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make more inquiries -- John Vorster Square -- the special branch -- but I don't hold out much hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a lawyer, Julius!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A black lawyer! Those Boers... the bastards'll kick him around till they lose him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the Baas? If he asks, they will give him an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the boy was flogged he didn't help. Why should he help him now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BEN'S GARDEN - MORNING Gordon is at work already -- 8 AM -- mowing the lawn. He's intense, unsmiling, burdened as he goes about his task, expertly. Sounds of BEN and JOHAN LAUGHING coming from inside. INT. BEN'S DEN - MORNING Ben and Johan, in robes, their hair still wet from their showers, having an imaginary boxing match. Johan has Ben on the ropes, backs him out of the house. EXT. BEN'S GARDEN Ben adjusts the sash of his robe and takes the offensive towards Johan, as he sees Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Gordon. No response.   Ben does a double-take and stops playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Johan) Hold it, champ. He crosses the yard to Gordon, fluffing his hair dry, Johan follows behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon, you okay? No response again. Gordon continues to work.     Ben and Johan exchange puzzled looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't this Jonathan's day to help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is he, recovering? Gordon stops, switches OFF the MACHINE, stands not looking at Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Mister Ben, sir -- the police took him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrested many. They even deny they've got him. He's disappeared...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disappeared? He's a child -- why didn't you tell me? Gordon just looks at him, sadly, patiently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay!   I'll see what I can find out. Ben walks off with Johan as Gordon STARTS the MOWER. INT. BEN'S STUDY - MORNING Ben is talking on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our gardener, yes. Probably nothing, but he's worried. INT. LAWYER'S OFFICE - DAY Sumptuous lawyer's offices, Johannesburg. They're lush- carpeted. A black woman cleaner is finishing off her early-morning chores, packing up as white staff are be- ginning to arrive. They're fresh, shining, attractive -- whipping the covers off typewriters. A young black girl, smart, well-groomed, is carrying a tray of coffee, desk to desk. FOLLOW her as she approaches her employer's open office door. We hear his voice -- see him on the phone in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And when was this? He nods, makes notes. He's in shirtsleeves.        At his post early, ready for action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ngubene -- Jonathan Ngubene. INT. LEWINSON'S OFFICE - DAY The coffee girl enters, places a cup on Lewinson's desk, and retreats. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get on to them straight away... Not at all -- I think better this time of morning -- after lunch, man, I'm a zombie. (laughs) Sure -- let you know straight away
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BARAGWANATH MORTUARY - DAY A white-uniformed assistant leads a line of African parents, reeking of sadness, into a cool room where metal drawers open from the walls. Stanley and JULIUS their black lawyer -- the two men seem to be very well-known, people shake hands with them, salute them -- Gordon and Emily's sadness is tinged with anger -- they have dignity, defiance, bowed with grief as they are. Stanley's large hand is placed gently on Emily's shoulder as they examine the dead faces before them. They belong to children, some    in torn, dirty clothes, others naked, some mutilated,    others whole and seemingly unharmed, as if asleep, until    the small, neat hole in temple or chest and the small    crust of blood is brought to our attention. A woman behind them starts to scream. They look around to see her holding onto a drawer, her legs buckling. Another woman pulls her close to grieve with her. The assistant approaches them and after a soft exchange he writes a name on a tag and ties it onto the body. The woman can't, won't leave her dead child. Her friend has to pull her away. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: love to, Susan... Cheers! (puts down phone; presses his intercom) Freda! Open an account... Du Toit. Benjamin Du Toit... Subject... Jonathan Ngubene. MONTAGE - SEARCH FOR JONATHAN A) TYPEWRITER -- CHATTERING out -- on Lewinson's headed note paper: To the Commissioner of Police Police Headquarters John Vorster Square Dear Sir, On behalf of our client, Gordon Ngubene, we are anxious to discover the whereabouts of his son... B) INT. POLICE HQ. (JOHN VORSTER SQUARE) - INTERROGATION ROOM Wellington, Jonathan's friend, is sitting alone in fear. Through the wall he can hear MOANING -- SCREAMS. He closes his eyes tight as if to shut out what he is hearing. C) POLICE TYPEWRITER -- CHATTERING out -- on police headquarters note paper: To Lewinson & Partners Solicitors Dear Sirs, With reference to your enquiry concerning Jonathan Ngubene, we suggest you take the matter up directly with the particular officer in charge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . D) HOSPITAL (JOHANNESBURG) Young black nurse carrying bedding -- corridor -- startled by moaning, screaming figure of black boy, being hustled on trolley into private ward. Boy is deposited on bed as policeman is posted outside. E) TYPEWRITER -- Lewinson's headed paper: ... the whereabouts of Jonathan Ngubene, aged
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who was apparently detained by you... F) 2ND POLICE TYPEWRITER -- Second heading: The type keys hesitate, tremble, for a considerable number of seconds, on and on, as if deliberately de- laying or uncertain how to answer. G) MATRON confronted by Gordon and Emily. She shakes her head vigorously, denying all knowledge, shows them the door. F) FINALLY: Dear Sirs, With reference to your enquiry seeking the whereabouts of Jonathan Ngubene, we are sorry to inform you we have no record of anyone of that name... I) HOSPITAL - WHITE SUPERINTENDENT FACING JULIUS SUPERINTENDENT It's preposterous. I would have known -- of such a case... I mean... in my hospital. You people! You're always raking up trouble! J) STANLEY At the back of police headquarters, John Vorster Square. An elderly black cleaner, emptying garbage, is being shown Jonathan's photograph. He looks -- and nods -- pointing down as meaning the basement. K) CLOSE ON STANLEY'S FACE END MONTAGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LEWINSON'S OFFICE - DAY He is with a client.    He pushes a button on the intercom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Freda -- I said no calls... Oh... Right... put them through. Hallo! Yes! How are you?... that is correct. He listens -- his face slowly becoming solemn -- LEWINSON Very well. Thank you for finally letting us know. He replaces the receiver... looks at it for a long second ... before lifting his eyes to the client.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. He dials a number. INT. DAN PIENAAR SCHOOL - STAFF ROOM - DAY Tea break for the teachers, Ben       among them. He is enjoy- ing a laugh with his colleagues       -- maybe in Afrikaans -- we should hear the language here       where we need not com- prehend. An African serves the        tea. There's a KNOCK -- a monitor comes in and talks to Ben who follows him outside. INT. SCHOOL - DAY Ben at the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Dan... No... it's all right... INT. LEWINSON'S OFFICE - DAY LEWINSON I'm sorry. They have just officially informed me. The boy was never in detention. He died ... the day of the riots and as nobody came to claim the corpse he was buried a month ago. INT. SCHOOL - DAY Ben at the phone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot, Dan... I'll tell Gordon. 'Bye. Ben hangs up and stays there... thinking... until the BELL snaps him out of his thoughts. EXT. DAN PIENAAR SCHOOL - PLAYING FIELDS - DAY The playing fields, not of Eton but as good as... ... Cries and whistles rise through the still, warm air from a game of schoolboy rugby being played below us by immaculately-fitted teams. On another part of the field Gordon's lawnmower off to the side -- two figures pace -- slowly -- one white, one black -- A VOICE overlays all this... strange... ironically African.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Ben, sir. If it was me, all right. And if it was Emily, all right. We are not young. But he's out child. My time and your time, it's passing. But the time of our children is coming. And now if they kill our children -- if we let them -- what is it that we lived for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can we do, Gordon? You or I... We can't change it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That day, Mr. Ben, sir, when they whipped Jonathan, you also said we can do nothing. But if we had... if someone heard what we had to say this would not have happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a terrible thing, Gordon -- God knows I'm sorry. But you have other children to live for... I'll help them too with their schooling. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did he die, Mister Ben, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, Gordon... He died on the day of the riots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what  they say. But I got to know for  certain. How can I have peace?   I must know how my son died and  where they buried him. The game on the next pitch finishes with a pierce of the whistle. The kids run off past Ben and Gordon. Gordon climbs onto the small lawn mower and STARTS the ENGINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon.   The police -- if they've said...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what they say. He is my child. God is my witness today: I cannot stop before I know what happened and where he lies. His body belongs to Emily and me. And drives away -- chugging across the field... leaving Ben -- helpless -- behind him -- watching. From his: OFFICE WINDOW in the school behind -- a worried headmaster watches. We hear his voice over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... This business of Gordon's son. Be careful, Ben. These are not normal times -- one has to make allowances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry! I'm no crusader. I've known Gordon a long time, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand -- it's your Christian duty to your neighbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that -- yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just don't get too close. Teachers must stay out of politics. Love to Susan! And drives off, leaving Ben watching him, shaking his head at the man's obtuseness. EXT. NGUBENE HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON Emily is watering a tiny vegetable plot in the yard, with a bucket and a pierced tin. Robert is playing nearby with the youngest child. Robert sees Gordon walking slowly to their house and says playfully to the baby:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look who's coming? It's baba! Emily turns to look. She immediately realizes that some- thing is wrong. She drops the tin and walks a few steps toward the gate. Gordon sees her and stops. Emily starts to break down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no... oh no, Lord. Gordon hurries to embrace her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't tell me... Gordon starts to lead her to the house. Margaret, Emily's neighbor, comes, hurries, helps her, comforts her, escorting them to the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SOWETO MAIN ROAD - DAY Stanley and Gordon are driving along Soweto main road. A 10-years-old BOY stops the car. INT. STANLEY'S CAR - DAY BOY (to Stanley) Baba, I heard you're looking for Wellington. He's out, Baba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he?   Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's with some boys at Dube's shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much. You've worked like a man. (turning to Gordon) Let's go. Stanley turns the car round and drives off at speed. EXT. DUBE'S SHOP - DAY Wellington and a few pals are standing outside the shop -- they greet Stanley as they see the car -- Stanley shouts back greeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it easy, boys. Hey Wellington! Wellington comes to the car.   He's limping, wearing sunglasses. As he's approaching the car, Stanley opens the back door for him. He enters and removes the glasses. Stanley notices a deep scar from the forehead to the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened... Don't tell me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they do that to you? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Wellington has a nervous arm-twitch... and nods to the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know what happened to Jonathan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't he out yet? (pause) I last saw him weeks ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to know how he died. INT. BEN'S DINING ROOM Sizette and   Chris with the family at dinner. Suzette is passed the   Rand Daily Mail newspaper by Chris, folded at an article   headlined: "WHAT REALLY HAPPENED TO JONATHAN NGUBENE?"    by Melanie Bruwer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't that tragic? Jonathan was such a nice boy. Even played with my Johan when they were small, God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he was such a nice boy, well- mannered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said he was very bright at school. Chris helps himself to more.     Suzette looks at the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, this kind of journalism doesn't help the situation. Look at her face? What does she look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Rand Daily Mail always exaggerates. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She passes the paper to Ben. He looks at Melanie's pic- ture: she looks 30 years old, long black hair, large dark eyes with a fierce, unsettling, uncompromising stare, a small nose and a generous and sensual mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks quite attractive to me. Chris and Johan laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (places a hand on Gordon's shoulder -- comforting)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CAR PARK The car park. He and Ben are getting into their cars at the end of the day. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he surveys the article; then with a serious tone)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ... Is only the latest in scores of black youths who have disappeared whilst in police custody.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does she expect? They're out of control. Give then an inch and they take a hundred miles. It's in their nature. The only language they understand is force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chris, Jonathan was fifteen, like me. Would you use force on me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not a terrorist. If you were -- like an increasing number of them, you'd deserve it. Look, every time you pick up the newspaper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, one hundred shot! They didn't have to kill them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This bloody Bruwer woman reports one hundred shot, but the radio said only twenty and the police were attacked first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought the idea was to give them their own areas, banstustans. Let them live with their own kind. No chance of conflict then. Everybody's happy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who would do the work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The work, who'd do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You for a start. Come on!    Help me clear these dishes. As Johan stands, to clear the table. He turns to his father with a smile, and shrugs -- an irritated Suzette joins them. INT. GORDON'S HOUSE (SOWETO) - NIGHT The small dark room is crowded. The one oil lamp -- on the table -- At the table sits Gordon... his glasses on the end of his nose. Emily is sitting by the stove.      Robert stands beside her chair, watching, listening. The youngsters are sleeping in opposite directions on the iron bed. Wellington is sitting beside Gordon at the table. There is something wild in his manner. He looks everywhere as if he is scared of being attacked unawares. The black cleaner from John Vorster Sq. stands near the table. Gordon is reading aloud from a handwritten document.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'On the second day of our detention at John Vorster Square we were taken to one of the top floors. We were ordered to undress and they started to beat us with fists and sjamboks. This for a long time.' Wellington nods and gets more paranoid. The black cleaner puts an understanding hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'On one day me and Jonathan...' Gordon pauses... steadies himself... pushes his glasses up his nose... clears his throat... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... We were asked questions for the whole day and night by Capt. Stolz and different policemen -- they never stopped. They tried to force us to say we were the leaders at our school, that we were working for the A.N.C. and got money from overseas. Capt. Stolz wanted to know the names of the students committee and where he can find Toni Mtimkulu -- Everytime they asked question, they beat us. It was bad beating.' Wellington nods again.    Emily closes her eyes to shut out the image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'We told them we had done nothing and didn't know about all the things they are asking us; on two occasion they put a wet bag over my head and I -- couldn't breathe
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I was going to die. One day I heard Jonathan being beaten. He was screaming and crying, and then a noise like tables and chairs being knocked down, and Capt. Stolz shouting "you bastard, get up, do you hear me?" Ngubene, don't pretend here, get up." Then the next day I heard he had gone to hospital and I never saw him again.' There's a long silence. Gordon closes his eyes and struggles with his grief. Emily sobs, Robert looks on in anger. Then, finally, Gordon offers a pen to Wellington, who is about to sign the foot of the state- ment, when... ... Suddenly there   is the sound of a TRUCK APPROACHING. Wellington rushes   to the front window and peers outside; then panics, fear   in his eyes, he runs into a bedroom and jumps through the   window. Everyone in the room is bewildered. The front door bursts open. Emily sits impassively look- ing at the five policemen (two whites and three Africans). The youngest child startled from his sleep starts to cry. Emily goes to the bed and picks the child up and returns to her chair. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay right where you are. He notices the papers on the table and picks them up.        He looks at them and realizes their importance. Capt. Stolz walks into the room and surveys the room and its occupants. Lieutenant Venter hands him the papers. He goes through them, nodding to himself as he reads silently. He folds them neatly and puts them into his inside jacket pocket. He walks up to Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your feet! So, you must be Gordon Ngubene? Gordon doesn't answer. He turns to the cleaner who automatically stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know each other, don't we? Calmly, he paces round the room looking around, then when he reaches the bed where the 10-years-old girl is watch- ing terrified, he pulls off the blankets, yanks the girl off the bed by her arm and frantically searches the bed. The child cries. Robert the brother goes to his sister and hugs her as he glares at Stolz with anger and hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gert, in daardie kammer. (Gert, that room) (turning to the other one) Jaimie, in die ander. (Jamie, the other room)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Niks, Kaptein. (Nothing, Captain)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the bastards away. The other policeman appears from the other bedrooms empty- handed. Gordon and the cleaner are roughly handled as they are handcuffed by the African Security Police. Over his shoulder Gordon manages to give Emily one last look, as he's hustled out of the house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Emily sits motionless, anger in her face.    She can hear the sound of the CARS DRIVING AWAY. Margaret (her neighbor) appears at the door. INT. BEN'S STUDY - NIGHT Behind Ben's house, are the servants' quarters attached to the garage. Ben has adapted what would have been a maid's room into his study and the adjoining room into a do-it-yourself workshop. The study has photographs of Ben's past as a provincial rugby player, of his family, school staff and TRECHIKOFF reproduction. On a cupboard are trophies of individual sports at university. He works off a plain desk on which is a handsome pipe- rack with several pipes. His indulgence is a comfortable easy chair. Ben's study, containing only the figure of Ben. He's hunched over his desk, looking blankly at the newspaper. His shirt is unbuttoned, his jacket slung across his chair. He draws heavily on his pipe, wreathing his head with smoke in the beam of the single desk light. He sits in his chair: Gordon's voice rises in his thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That day, Mister Ben, sir, when they whipped Jonathan, you also said we can do nothing. God as my witness today: I must know what happened and where he lies. His body belongs to Emily and me. He mutters -- more a prayer than a curse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeezus -- Jeezus -- Jeezus Christ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night, Papa! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Johan is entering, knocking on the half-open door. He's in his pajamas and dressing gown, ready for bed. Ben looks up at him. Johan kisses his father who suddenly clasp his son hard, clinging to him for dear life. The boy throws his arms around his dad's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Papa! Susan appears at the door with a cup of coffee. She's had a bath -- her hair is wet -- and she's in her housecoat. Ben and Johan don't notice her approach. She watches sympathetically for a moment, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee!   Come on, Johan.   Time for bed. Johan pulls back from his father's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, son.   Go and get some sleep. The boy nods and leaves. As Susan rests the cup of coffee on the desk before Ben. She notices the Rand Daily Mail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm proud of you, Ben... what you've done for that family. But darling, you shouldn't take these things to heart so much. What more can you do about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.    I'm just tired, I suppose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, come to bed. Her housecoat has fallen open.       He lifts his face to hers and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will, in a minute. I'll just put the thoughts of Standar Six away. They mustn't be lost to posterity. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She chuckles, satisfied, leaving him. He picks up his cup and drinks. He thinks again for a moment. Then he removes a photocopied letter from an envelope and reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Seeking the whereabouts of a certain Jonathan Ngubene, regret to inform you we have no record of anyone of that name...' INT. CLASSROOM - DAY Afrikaan boys in uniform hunching over their desks writing... On the blackboard: the date and history test: What year did the first white man arrive in South Africa? When was the Battle of Blood River? Who was the Zulu chief who was defeated at the battle of Isanadlawana? Who was the president of the first Afrikander Republic? Give the route of the Voortrekkers from the cape? Ben walks through the aisles and from time to time oppor- tunities to glance at the window at Gordon's motionless tractor sitting in the field. He turns back   and notices a boy focusing on the ceiling. His pen in his   mouth, trying desperately to find the answers. Ben    has a smile, then crosses to him, bends down and strikes a   similar pose. The class breaks up into laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, time up! Hand in your test. Moans from the students. EXT. DAN PIENAAR SCHOOL - VERANDA - DAY Ben appears on the other side of the veranda. He is in Cloete's company -- the little big man... grey hair... 65 years old. The headmaster. They stop in before Ben's colleague, Vivier, passing, shakes hands with him. A woman arrives and waits. Cloete says something to Ben, then laughs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Ben smiles and Cloete goes into the office. The woman approaches Ben... talks to him... they both turn back to see... ... Emily standing there, a soaking headscarf tied native- style around her head. Ben thanks the woman and crosses the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happened, Emily?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Baas... but it's Gordon. EXT. DAN PIENAAR SCHOOL - DAY ... Stanley is waiting in his car.     His sunglasses on his nose... ... The SCHOOL BELL RINGS to give the end of the tea inter- val. Ben walks out with Emily to Stanley's car. Stanley gets out, they stare at each other. Finally Stanley breaks the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it? I'm Stanley! I heard about you! Ben feels a little uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Stanley Makhaya... He helps us all the time. Stanley opens the door to Emily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry too much, Emily, I'm sure Gordon will be home in a few days. Stanley slaps the door with a big laugh.     He gets into the car and drives away. CLOSE ON BEN perplexed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - JOHN VORSTER SQUARE - DAY Gordon stands facing the wall, his arm raised.    He has wetted his trousers. Captain Stolz is pacing behind him. Lieutenant Venter, sitting on the edge of the desk, is smoking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Kaffir, talk!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, I've done nothing.   All I tried to do was to find... Stolz interrupts him with a blow to his face.    As Gordon drops his hands, the officer shouts to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up with those bloody arms!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't like gramophone records here! Now who has been giving you informations? Gordon doesn't answer. The Lieutenant walks slowly to him, calmly removes his fag-end of cigarette from his lips and stubs it on Gordon's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very calmly) Why don't you answer the Captain, han? He walks back to his place. Captain Stolz opens the door and shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johannes!    The bag! Gordon has a look of terror. Immediately a black security policeman walks in with a bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Johannes goes to wet the bag in a bucket in a corner. Lieutenant Venter grabs Gordon, throws him onto a chair and handcuffs his hands behind the chair. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Stolz is supervising. The Lieutenant places the wet bag over Gordon's head and ties it. Gordon starts groaning and wriggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody will meet you on second floor. Ben enters a lift. INT. INTERROGATION ROOM (JOHN VORSTER SQUARE) - DAY Gordon's still sitting on the chair, slumped -- Johannes removes the handcuffs as the Lieutenant removes the wet bag. Gordon is breathing heavily and semi-conscious. Suddenly Captain Stolz punches him heavily on the face. Gordon drops on the floor with blood gushing from his nose and mouth. Captain Stolz grabs him by his collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on you bloody black bastard. Who has been telling you lies? The PHONE RINGS.    Stolz drops Gordon and walks to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be down immediately, Colonel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. VILJOEN'S OFFICE - DAY Behind the large desk, Colonel VILJEON replaces the tele- phone receiver; there is a KNOCK on the door -- and a young policeman ushers in Ben. Colonel Viljoen stands and ex- tends a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in, Mr. Du Toit, come in. How do you do? They shake.   He's a large, friendly man, ruddy face, gray crew cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you, Colonel Viljoen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to watch you play for the Transvaal. You were one of the great wing forwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grinning) Long time ago. There's a KNOCK on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. The door opens revealing Captain Stolz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Stolz, Mr. Du Toit. Captain Stolz nods correctly, unsmiling, comfortably dressed, English-style. He shakes hands with Ben. Then walks toward the window and stands there. As he's watching Ben, he begins to clean out his pipe with a silver penknife;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Ben) Do sit down. Ben sinks into a low leather chair before the desk.    Be- hind him he can feel Stolz's eyes. Viljoen peers through his half-moons at the letter in front of him. The pipe scraping continues behind Ben's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right now, Gordon Ngubene. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... to put it simply, Colonel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm always grateful for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought there might have been some kind of misunderstanding I could help straighten out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know him, Colonel. He works at my school. He's done work for me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you feel you know him enough to vouch for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, after so many years... 10 years. Gordon's not the type to get himself in trouble. He's an honest, hard-working, church- going man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha! You'd be surprised how many honest, decent, church-going men we come across during a working day. He leans back comfortably in his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's routine, Mr. Du Toit -- a routine enquiry. Cleaning up these townships we must leave no stone unturned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate that -- but Gordon would never...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not an easy task either -- the press screaming blue murder -- especially the English. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they'll be the first to squeal if the Reds took over, make no mistake. Rushing back overseas clutching their bloody British passports. Have you any idea what will happen here if we don't follow every lead? We have a duty -- obligation. You have your job -- we have ours. Ben hastens to reassure him. He looks directly at Ben, frank, open, trustworthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel -- believe me, I'm with you all the way. But in this case -- I'm sure that in your worthy pursuit of the guilty you have, unwittingly, involved the innocent. After all, we're all human. We all make mistakes sometimes. Viljoen laughs again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are indeed, Mr. Du Toit -- we are indeed. Though there's many who might need persuading as to that fact. Then... authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Du Toit. While you're here, would you mind if I asked you a few questions about Ngubene?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colonel, I'd welcome it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good! There's another pause. The Colonel takes out a fountain pen -- unscrews it -- and arranges a sheet before him before speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we start with his son? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jonathan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eldest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   He died some time ago. Viljoen doesn't react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about Gordon's activities since Jonathan's death? The noise stops behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing, Colonel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Gordon ever discuss the death with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course he did -- he was upset. The Colonel pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he accepted the truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a religious man... in the end he would have resigned himself to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would have? You mean he didn't? Was he angry? Rebellious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Colonel! If one of your kids died... (nods to family picture on desk) ... and nobody would tell you how it happened or where his body is buried, wouldn't you be upset?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We told him how his son died, Mr. Du Toit. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Ben turns back, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a son, Mr. Du Toit? The Colonel looks up at him... the first sign of steel in his eyes... then back to the papers. The noise starts again behind Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he burn and destroy -- everything he can lay his hands on?... No -- and neither does mine. That's what I can't understand... after everything the government does for them. (looks straight at Ben) Think about it, Mr. Du Toit. We're for you, not against you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never doubted it, Colonel. It's you who appear to be doubting me. These questions.   You're making me feel like a criminal. There's a moment's pause -- then a burst of laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mr. Du Toit... I'm sorry. It's force of habit. Once a policeman, always a policeman, eh? More laughter -- Ben joins in.    Viljoen stands, signalling an end to the meeting. EXT. BEN'S CAR - DAY Johan is sitting, waiting, in the parked car... the RADIO ON. He's bored. INT. COLONEL'S OFFICE VILJOEN ... As soon as we're satisfied he's innocent, he will be released. We know what we're doing, Mr. Du Toit. You want your wife and that boy of yours to sleep safe tonight, don't you? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Ben nods, smiles, makes for the door, turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One last favor, Colonel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire away!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon's wife -- she's very worried. May she bring him some food and a change of clothes while he's still here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No problem!    Thank you for your help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.    I'll rely on you, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you find your way out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. And thanks.    I feel much happier now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good! And give my regards to your father-in-law -- tell him we'll have a drink sometime -- maybe go to a game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will.   Goodbye. And the door shuts behind him. There's silence for a moment... Viljoen staring at the closed door -- Stolz looks expectantly at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the little bird singing yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm working on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Stolz leaves, shutting the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. JON VORSTER SQUARE Ben opening his car. Johan is sitting in the front seat. As Ben gets into the car, he glances at the John Vorster Square building. INT. BEN'S CAR - DAY Ben is motoring through and out of Johannesburg.    Johan is silent beside him, impatient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I talked to them. Gordon will be released soon. The colonel was very understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see Gordon? Ben suddenly realizes that he didn't ask to see Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (embarrassed) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did they say anything about Jonathan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, but... Johan, he is dead. We can't do anything for him. Don't mention this visit to your mother. Okay? INT. DU TOIT KITCHEN - NIGHT Suzette and Susan in the kitchen arranging the dessert tray. The kitchen is surprisingly neat. LAUGHTER is coming from the dining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What extra-mural interest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Champion of political detainees! Ben comes in to open extra bottles of wine, hears Susan's line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing, turns to Ben) Is that right, Papa? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Suzette. But, only one detainee: 'Gordon!'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our Gordon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God. What on earth for? Susan leaves the kitchen without a word, with the dessert plates on the tray to the dining room. INT. DU TOIT HOUSE - DINING ROOM - NIGHT Susan reaches VIVIERS and the minister DOMINEE BESTER, with their dessert plates. The candles have burned down amid the detritus of dinner: glasses disarranged and dirty, the cloth spotted with food and wine and ashes. In addition to Viviers, dateless, and Bester and his wife, the school's headmaster, Cloete and his wife. INT. DU TOIT HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT Ben hastily uncorking a bottle of wine while talking to Suzette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It must be a mistake, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it is. I went down there, told them. They're looking into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Went down where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John Vorster Square. Suzette giggles, amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You old devil you. Does Ma know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. And you're not going to tell her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: A pause.   She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful. I don't want my favorite Papa in trouble, Gordon or no Gordon. She ruffles his hair, smiles, kisses him.       They go back into the dining room. INT. DINING ROOM - NIGHT BEN More wine?   Viviers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for me, Oom Ben. I'm drunk enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Cloete?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! Ben serves her. Susan passes to fetch milk jug and sugar basin from the chine cupboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I saw those sheets you liked, Sally, on sale at Bloom's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you be free on Wednesday afternoon? I have one or two other things to buy. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT Susan enters the kitchen. As she is about to place the jug and basin on the table next to the tray with cups of the same set, there is a knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. The door opens and Stanley steps in. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. Viviers returns to his seat as Ben shuts the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's you... hum... Stanley, isn't it? (to Susan) That's all right, darling. Ben leads Stanley out of the kitchen, closing the door behind him. CLOSE ON SUSAN intrigued. INT. LEWINSON'S HOME - NIGHT Lewinson is at the phone, behind him his wife, too, is entertaining guests for dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friday night, man! I'm no doctor, I'm not on standby all the bloody time. Can't they wait 'til Monday? INT. BEN'S STUDY - NIGHT BEN Dan! I'm standing here with Gordon's clothing in my hand. It's bloodstained... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are broken teeth in the pocket. Monday may be too late! (pause) The lawyer has been banned. Stanley is waiting, his great hand on his hips, the other one on Emily's shoulder. She is sitting on a chair. Obviously, Stanley doesn't expect a positive response. INT. LEWINSON HOME - NIGHT LEWINSON (interested) Do you mean Julius Nqakula? (pause) Too bad, he's a good lawyer. Why are you getting so involved, Ben? INT. BEN'S STUDY - NIGHT BEN I'm just trying to help Gordon. ... You represented many cases, tell me, does this happen often? (pause) But Gordon's not political. (pause) Okay, Dan, I'm sorry for disturbing your weekend. Ben replaces the phone.    Turns to Emily and Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He agrees to see you tomorrow and will apply to the supreme court for an interdict to stop any assaults on Gordon. And, we'll find out what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're all right, Lanie. Ben can just hear Emily's soft voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Baas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, sisi. Tomorrow it'll all be first-class again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. DU TOIT LOUNGE - NIGHT Laughter again. Ben has rejoined the party in the lounge. The women are together talking, laughing and the men on their own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More coffee, anyone? General assent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The security police don't arrest people for nothing, Ben. Leave it alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They could make a mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blacks lead double lives. One you see and one you don't. These people surprise you all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (joking) That's what I like about them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not concerned with 'blacks.' We're talking about GORDON. A good man and very loyal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (serving coffee to Cloete) And a hard worker too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hard worker? I had to get rid of him. Susan doesn't react.   She leaves to join the womens' group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fired him a few days before he was arrested for staying away from work for days. And for the sake of the school I say good riddance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean 'good riddance'? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a responsibility for the children. These are troubled times, Ben, we can't trust the natives any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to be extra careful about any influences, Oom Ben. Even their churches are breeding grounds for all sorts of evil ideas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon's not subversive and definitely not a Communist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he's got nothing to worry about!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except his three teeth. Our government mustn't allow such things to happen. After all, it's a Christian government. (turning to Bester) What do you say, Dominee? Bester doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not talking about the government! I believe in our government, damn it... His sharp tone surprises everybody.    He quiets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Look, I know the police often know more than we do. I'm not questioning that. I'm as loyal as the next man. But I do know Gordon Ngubene... there is something wrong. There's a moment's embarrassed silence, broken by Suzette's entrance with a tray of glasses and a bottle of brandy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else, Papa? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Ben starts pouring, and offers the first glass to Bester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dominee? Bester shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nee Dankie. Ben hands the glass to Viviers. Immediately Viviers raises his glass and laughingly says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oom, Ben, may your problems be small ones! INT. INTERROGATION ROOM (JOHN VORSTER SQUARE) - DAY Gordon is undoing his trousers. Venter roughly drops the trousers and pushing him to the floor. He handcuffs him while Johannes pulls off the trousers and underpants, and manacles his ankles. Johannes fetches a rod. Venter goes to a cupboard, pulls out two electric wires with electrodes attachments and places them on the desk. All the preparation is done with practiced efficiency. From the adjoining room there are angry shouts of a woman. Venter and Johannes place the rod between Gordon's elbow- joints and the back of his knees. The door opens. Gordon has a look of terror on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I'm late. Captain Stolz enters carrying a thickish file under his arms, goes straight to the desk and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnannes, the table. Johannes moves the table in line with the desk. Lieutenant Venter and Johannes lift the trussed Gordon and the ends of the rod between the desk and table. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a heavy shitface. Too much mealie porridge! Captain Stolz holds Gordon by the head and swings him like a pendulum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you feel today?   Ready to fly? Very calmly Captain Stolz pulls out some papers from the file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mister Ngubene, we know about this Wellington... and... (pointing another affidavit) ... We know about him... and him ... Now, we want the names of the others. And today you're going to tell us. The WOMAN in the next room SHOUTING louder than before -- that one is a real and tough activist -- STOLZ (to himself) Bloody woman. (to Johannes) Water! As Johannes is fetching the bucket of water.        Venter goes to the cupboard and stays there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Samson' is ready, Captain, shall I switch him on? Johannes empties the bucket over Gordon.     Stolz attaches the terminal to Gordon's earlobes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   Gert! Gordon is given a short burst of electric shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hai! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a small taste of 'Samson.' We have a whole day... A knock at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Kom! A black policeman in uniform.       JOHNSON SEROKE, enters with a letter in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A letter for you, Captain. Stolz goes to take the letter and turns to place it on his desk. He notices Seroke still standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you bloody-well waiting for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reply, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here. Seroke leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now about these affidavits who told you to collect them? The A.N.C.? Who recruited you? Gordon mumbles something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? He bends forward to hear, and Gordon's swollen, puffy eyes hold his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know anything about the A.N.C.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've had your chance.    Now you're going to shit. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reg gert. (Okay, Gert) Gordon suddenly shakes violently and shouts repeatedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hai!   Hai!   Hai! INT. DUTCH REFORM CHURCH - MORNING Dominee Bester is preaching from the pulpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God created the whole human race so that they could occupy the entire earth. He decreed how long each nation should flourish, and what the boundaries of each territory should be. Our task is to preserve that creative diversity. Behind him, in his deacon's black tails, Ben listens with clasped hands. On the opposite side, another man is lis- tening, standing in the love of his family, Cloete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brothers and sisters, like our forebears, the Voortrekkers, who trekked into the wilderness preserve the Afrikanere way of life given to them by God. Today, we also live in times of great danger. Let not fear overcome you! Cling to the ways of justice and truth preserved by our leaders. So shall God be honored... BEN'S POV The faces    of his friends scattered among the pews, Suzette and Susan    listening intently, Johan beside her visibly bored, his    eyes wandering to the Cloete's daughter at the end of    the pew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... So shall the Afrikaner people flourish. The organ plays the opening notes to a hymn, the congre- gation rises and sings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BEN'S GARAGE - DAY Ben's garage/workshop -- the door is open. Ben and Johan are together building a strong desk for Johan. The RADIO offers MUSIC to keep them company.   Susan is confronting Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me you'd been down to John Vorster Square?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What difference would it have made?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your wife, damn it! She turns the RADIO DOWN, irritably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to upset you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Upset me? It upsets me when you share your bloody secrets with a child! Johan is embarrassed. Ben glances at him. Johan shrugs and shakes his head "not me." Ben planes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben! Ben! Look at me for God sakes! (turns to Johan) Johan uit met jou! Johan leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (posing down the plane) Now what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a good life. We may not have everything we might have had if...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (interrupts) ... If I'd been more ambitious. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben, what's happening? (pause) Sometimes it seems to me I don't know you. Ben looks at her. Her tone is panic, urgent. She looks afraid. He crosses over to her, takes her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening -- it's something I've never had to face -- deal with -- before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's the gardener for God's sake, not one of the family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be patient with me... When Gordon is free you'll have me all to yourself again... promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben.    We're growing old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nonsense. One's as old as he feels. I feel young and very attractive. I can still do my duty. She smiles up at him, chuckles, and then they kiss. Johan interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. POLICE HEADQUARTERS (JOHN VORSTER SQUARE) - DAY Under the gaze of a uniformed POLICEMAN in a bulletproof glass cage, Ben fills in a slip, then hands it to the Policeman, who then makes a phone call. Whilst waiting, Ben notices a video surveillance camera. Just then, a 20-year-old African girl, Afro-style hair, is brought in held on both sides by two white policemen. She is taken into a lift. Ben watches them enter the lift and follows the progress of lift to the 10th floor. The Policeman stamps the slip and gives it to Ben.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. DINING ROOM - NIGHT Ben and guests hear Susan. Ben jumps up, hurries to the door.    Viviers starts to follow. INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT Ben stops at the door, sees Stanley, turns to Viviers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (putting the tray in front of Ben)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Stanley's here, Papa. Johan leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, bloody hell! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Susan exclaims in angry frustration and flees. Stanley appears at the garage door.     He stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? The news leaves Ben speechless.      Stanley continues in flat, emotionless tones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bastards say he committed suicide... hanged himself. Ben, recovering from the shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suicide... is that what they told Emily -- poor woman...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't tell her. She heard it on the radio like the rest of us. I contacted Lewinson immediately. He then rung the police to ask why Emily wasn't informed. Would you believe it, they said they were sorry, and they didn't know where to contact her. Ben walks slowly out of the garage in deep thoughts -- Stanley follows him. EXT. GARAGE - DAY BEN (almost to himself) God! I never thought Gordon could commit suicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you understand me? I said, they said he committed suicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon wasn't a coward. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean 'but'? What about Timol who they said had jumped from a top-floor window? What about Ngudle? What about Mosala? Joyi? Malele? They all died in that John Vorster Square. All suicide, eh? Ben stares at him. There is something like a strange silence between them. Ben is confused and Stanley is staring at him. Ben breaks this embarrassing mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything I can do to help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brothers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm his brother, man, we all are! We'll take care of everything. (with pride) That's the African way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley, I'd like to see Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look for trouble, man. You know there are riots all over Soweto. You're out of it. Why don't you stay out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you understand?   I've got to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to go? Of course, Lanie... the last farewell. But we have to be careful. INT. STANLEY'S CAR - DAY Stanley drives sportingly as he talks to Ben, seated in the back. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We expected it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you talk like that!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A guy gets picked up by the S.B... he's part of history, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you had no hope, you didn't believe he'd be released?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope's a white word, Lanie... It's not hope we need. There's silence for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank God Emily has you to lean on, Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emily is like my sister... We go back many years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you belong to the xhosa tribe too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am an African. That's all! (looking through the rear mirror) Comprende?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am an African too! Stanley turns abruptly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was fourteen before I wore shoes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: except for church... I grew up on a plaas miles from any town... watching sheep and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit! Next you'll have me believing we grew up in the same country, same laws, same freedom, same everything! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He laughs. EXT. SOWETO BORDER - DAY STANLEY (like a tour guide) We are now about to leave the white jungle and entering the land of love and glory. The car approaches a huge perimeter notice: "YOU ARE NOW ENTERING SOWETO TOWNSHIP.    NO PERSON WITHOUT THE NECESSARY PERMIT IS ALLOWED..." Ben is driven into a different world; children playing in dirty streets, in wrecks of cars, open spaces devoid of vegetables, smoke from large rubbish dumps, burnt-out skeletons of buses, beer halls and buildings. Clusters of policemen in battle dress patrolling in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this is Soweto.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Land of love and glory, Lanie! (turning suddenly to Ben) But watch out for the police and army. They're patrolling all the time. The car follows an isolated broken stretch of tarred road hill cluttered with rusty tins, cardboard containers, bottles. EXT. FUNERAL PARLOR - DAY A group of young children playing under the blinding sun in a muddy ditch, notice the big painted butterfly on the hood of Stanley's car. They wave and scream at Stanley in their language and he screams back at them. Two little girls start running, heading toward the car. Stanley notices the red VW parked in a corner. He man- euvers and parks his car nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up, Lanie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEN'S POV A modern funeral parlor with its name painted on the side: "MOROKA FUNERAL DIRECTOR (PTY) LTD." BACK TO SCENE Stanley notices the two little girls with dusty smiling faces, standing there waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sweets today. I'm sorry, babies. The children give Stanley a coy disbelieving look as they watch him go with the "white man." CHILDREN'S POV On the doorstep of the funeral parlor: Stanley and Ben run into a young woman coming out with a shoulder bag and a camera. The young woman and Stanley exchange a quick, friendly greeting -- it's MELANIE BRUWER, the Rand Daily reporter -- and keep moving. BACK TO SCENE Ben turns back for a moment. Her face seems familiar to him. He would like to talk to her, but there is no time. Stanley is already inside. INT. FUNERAL PARLOR - DAY Ben and Stanley follow the proprietor who is expensively- dressed in a dark suit. Gordon's coffin stands as one of many in the room. Inside the casket, brass fittings, white satin, lies Gordon, incongruous, ludicrous in a black Sunday suit. His hands are crossed on his chest like the claws of a bird and his face, barely recognizable, is gray, the left side distorted, blackish purple. There are rough stitches of the postmortem across his skull and a scar on his lips. Stanley speaks in an African language to the undertaker. The man opens Gordon's shirt and reveals the bruised and battered chest. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Stanley observes Ben who looks at the wounds with horror. Then another command from Stanley and the undertaker opens the shirt to the waist. Ben's ashen. Stanley thanks the man and turns to leave. Ben remains a minute. He shuts his eyes tightly. Now he saw it. Now he must believe it. He must accept that this battered corpse is Gordon. As he follows Stanley, he thanks the undertaker. EXT. FUNERAL PARLOR - DAY Outside the "sunlight," the children's laughter and Stanley, hands in pockets, waiting for Ben by the car. The same two little girls approach Stanley who gives them some coins -- they run off happily. Ben is coming outside blinking in the glaring sunlight. Stanley glares at Ben, who is pale, shaken and silent. They get into the car in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to Ben) 'The living close the eyes of the dead. The dead open the eyes of the living.' Stanley starts the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, take me to Emily. Stanley looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, we'd took one hell of a chance to get here, let's not push it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really have to see her, Stanley. Stanley drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (determined; looking through rearview mirror) I said don't push it. I have to keep you alive. What's more the house is full of mourners. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: They drive in silence... then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are your thoughts now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. I know you came to see the body. What do you think now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I... I cannot think.   I'm confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You either believe what you saw or maybe you still prefer the government version.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Christ sake, just get off my back, Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   It was a simple question. Stanley turns his RADIO ON and BANTU MUSIC invades the car as it speeds away in a cloud of dust. EXT. WHITE SUBURB STREET - LATE AFTERNOON The big brassy Dodge is threading its way through the leafy calm of the white suburb. The "Bantu" MUSIC is STILL PLAYING on the radio under Stanley's animated conversation with Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Lanie, when you run a taxi, especially a pirate taxi like me, you have eyes and ears everywhere. Even when a policeman farts in his bed you know. People want a reference book, a permit to stay in Soweto, a house, anything, we taxi drivers know the routes. I'll tell you something... A news bulletin in African language interrupts the music. Stanley listens. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Hassiem has been picked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's he? Stanley silently pulls up along the curb and comes to rest at Ben's gate. EXT. BEN'S HOUSE - ENTRANCE - LATE EVENING STANLEY Dr. Hassiem is the doctor we got to represent Emily at Gordon's autopsy. We wanted the truth. Ben suddenly realizes the significances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He would have testified.   Bloody hell!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A smart move by your Boer brothers. They have silenced Hassiem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His report has to be important. We can only use what we have. Therefore, Lewinson must get a very good advocate. (pause) If only we could get   hold of this Hassiem's report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the use? It's one big game and we blacks are merely spectators. Hey Lanie, can one be a spectator as he's being kicked around? He laughs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a question of being spectators. The courts are impartial, the law is what matters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you all say. I have to move man. Your neighbors! Now, be careful. They will put their marks on you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Stanley takes an empty cigarette packet from his pocket, he writes on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll find out! (handing the packet to Ben) In case you need me. Don't give your name -- just say 'Lanie' phoned -- right? Ben gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now tomorrow at ten...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sharp! At our smart liberal friend's office, yeh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. Stanley drives vigorously away. Ben walks slowly and thoughtfully towards his house.         He notices Susan watching him through the window. He slumps on a chair on the veranda as Susan comes out of the house followed by Johan -- they both stand slightly worried at his moroseness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went to Soweto and saw Gordon's body. They have lied to me, my own people -- they killed him! I saw the body. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Johan looks horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben, you're not a doctor. His death was announced officially. They wouldn't say anything unless they were certain of their facts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Facts? There's a doctor who participated at the autopsy.   A Doctor Hassiem and he...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the Indian doctor who's been arrested?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was in the five o'clock news, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's him, he represented Emily at the autopsy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben, I'm sorry about Gordon's death, but please for all our sakes, forget about this whole thing. Let's get back to a normal life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brandy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always know what I need. Johan hurries into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Ben, I'm frightened. She turns and walks into the house, leaving Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SOWETO CEMETERY - MORNING The large Soweto cemetery has scores of graves ready for burials. The chief mourners, Emily, Robert, his sister, Margaret, four relatives and Stanley are standing on either side of the PRIEST. Gordon's coffin is in the grave; several wreaths are on the side of the grave. There are about fifteen hundred mourners, and half are youths. There are several local reporters and overseas television reporters. The police are in attendance in large numbers at the edge of the crowd, some in battle dress and some with dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before I conclude, I have to say we are tired of making this journey every day, sometimes twice in one day, burying our children, and those, like our departed brother, Ngubene who were merely seeking the truth; and those who have been denounced by traitors amongst us; and those who have been brutally killed for no reason, yes I shall say it, by the police. Let those who rule this land of ours listen to the word of God; let them listen to our peaceful and just demands; let them be humble and go down on their knees and seek forgiveness, then listen to God. The crowd roars:   "Amanda!   Amanda!" The Priest starts a short hymn and the crowd joins in. At the end of the hymn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will have a few words from Mr. Pilani our father and leader. The crowd starts singing a freedom song with arms raised. The funeral has now become a political demonstration. Mr. Pilani, who is a dignified, educated 70-years-old, walks slowly and waits beside the chief mourners. He is handed a loudspeaker. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: A SENIOR POLICE OFFICER threads his way through the crowd, a loud hailer in his hand. As he reaches the grave he turns. The crowd is quiet. He says something to the Priest then addresses the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The funeral is over. I order everyone to go home. This is not a political rally. I repeat, disperse. As though by signal the police start attacking the mourners with truncheons and dogs. There is pandemon- ium, women screaming, people falling into graves or covering in them. The Priest and Stanley lead Emily and the family away in the opposite direction. The press and television are recording the scene. The police start throwing tear gas canisters. There is no confrontation, the crowd is fleeing in all directions. One television cameraman is purposely pushed into a grave by a very young policeman, his round recordist is pulled up into the adjourning grave by the connecting cord. Melanie stands on a tombstone watching and making notes. INT. BEN'S LOUNGE - NIGHT Ben, Susan watching the main evening news bulletin on TV. On the screen a sequence of rioting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Despite repeated warnings young blacks attacked the police with rocks and petrol bombs. Five policemen were injured. Susan briefly glances at Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several arrests were made. One youth was killed and five wounded. Follows the newscaster and then reports:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This morning there was a serious disturbance at the funeral of Gordon Ngubene. Susan leaves the room. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The detainee who committed suicide by hanging himself at John Vorster Square. An overseas television cameraman broke an arm during the disturbance. It's been reported that several people had been killed by a car-bomb in Belfast Northern Island... Ben turns OFF the TV and stays in his thoughts. EXT. JOHANNESBURG - STREET - AFTERNOON Stanley and Ben are driving in the outskirts of Johannesburg. EXT. APPROACHES OF SOWETO - AFTERNOON Stanley drives seemingly alone at very high speeds, which he maintains through the streets of Soweto... using his horn to scatter people out of his way, to the anger and indulgence of others. The CAR SCREECHES to a halt outside Emily's house. Stanley gets out of the car and greets the startled neighbors... and acknowledges the friendly shouts of children. Stanley looks around, then goes back to the car, opens the back door, leans and says something. Suddenly, to everyone's astonishment, Ben crawls out of the car; Stanley hustles him into Emily's house. Stanley waves at the people, a sign of assurance, then closes the door behind him. INT. EMILY'S HOUSE - AFTERNOON Ben stands awkwardly for a moment, taking in the room and the people in it. He then walks over to Emily who is standing at the table. He goes to shake her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you, Emily?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank you, Mr. Ben, sir. Eh, that's father Masonwane, our priest, and that's Margaret from next door. Ben nods at them.    Stanley sits himself down. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mfundisi... (priest) ... Sisi! (sister)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please sit down. Take this chair, the other one is broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to disturb you. I've come to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's good. What I want to know is why did they kill him. He didn't do them nothing. You know, Mr. Ben, sir, I washed his whole body for he was my husband. And I know a man who killed himself, he doesn't look like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Master, you must understand she's still raw inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure. Robert walks in, looks at Ben and walks into his bedroom to fetch something, then as he's about to go out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robert, where are you manners today? Don't you greet visitors? Robert stops momentarily and looks at Ben with hostility and hurries out of the room banging the door.
direction.name: direction
